channel.title: How to really piss off students/teachers at your school
channel.description:
Here is a video I made describing how to find the Name of a school server and shut it down, stopping people from accessing and saving their files.
I will test this at school in a few days, however, seeing as my Servers are more secure than the ones at school, I am sure that it will work.
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PCA8LVVf7A0
Credits: Mostly me, for spending a while mucking around on the computer finding these things out Some to Microsoft for making windows Some to that screen recording program I used. Reply.

item.title: How to really piss off students/teachers at your school
item.dc:creator: @bloodrayne bloodrayne
item.description:
@bloodrayne wrote:

Yeah so sort of off topic, I’m graduating Tuesday and figured I’d spread the Administrator password around school. Will report back with results

Read full topic

item.title: How to really piss off students/teachers at your school
item.dc:creator: @nade nade
item.description:
@nade wrote:

Everyone here is an idiot. Use mmc to make a new account and add it to the administrators group. I don’t think there is a policy which prohibits the use of it. The only thing though: it might not allow to use the Users tool in computer management add-in unless you have Server/Ultimate/Business(?) edition of windows.

If you succeed,

  1. You can now log in locally rather than on a domain where everything is monitored.
  2. No restrictions.

Read full topic

item.title: How to really piss off students/teachers at your school
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

[quote=“Dumke[AtomicFury”]link=topic=313281.msg3021033#msg3021033 date=1257600060]

Too bad you can’t use CMD on most computers at school.

Giant Bump?

Well here a little secret most people don’t realise.

open up notepad.

type “Command.com”

then save as anything, .bat

open there ya go, commandprompt[/quote]

You do understand that you were the one who bumped it. His post was October 18, 2008. Whereas yours is a a 6 month bump.

Read full topic

item.description:
@runescape3dude wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:16, topic:237270”][quote author=la­wl link=topic=313281.msg2788888#msg2788888 date=1242616056]
that shit doesnt work unless they have windows 98 or somethin
[/quote]

And if they have windows 98 you can login as default, admin, or administrator without a password, or if you don’t want to type a username just hit ‘cancel’ to log in with full access. (Ah, the days of windows 98, so secure…)[/quote]
Yea, I always did that last year at my school.

Too bad you can’t use CMD on most computers at school.
[/quote]

item.source: How to really piss off students/teachers at your school

item.title: How to really piss off students/teachers at your school
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

[quote=“Davidude, post:11, topic:237270”][quote author=Dans The Man link=topic=313281.msg2766425#msg2766425 date=1240841176]
lol how’d that happen?
[/quote]
Don’t really understand how it happened, I think I must have been sitting at a teachers computer.[/quote]
Someone in my school actualy looked over a teacher while he was typing his password and then when he wasnt in the room logged in and went onto youtube.

You cannot open C:\WINDOWS\system32\cmd.exe at my school so I cannot do anything. The USB ports and CD-Drive are disable via BIOS which is password protected so they only way to break into my school network is to open the computer remove the CMOS bettery and then try to use a Live CD and do some things.

Read full topic
item.source: How to really piss off students/teachers at your school

item.source: How to really piss off students/teachers at your school

item.title: How to really piss off students/teachers at your school
item.dc:creator: @Dans_The_Man Dans The Man
item.description:
@Dans_The_Man wrote:

[quote=“Davidude, post:8, topic:237270”][quote author=Java Is My Life™ link=topic=313281.msg2582706#msg2582706 date=1229308765]
Why would you even attempt this? If your school is anything like mine you need to login with your Student ID/library number and the board administrators can see what you’re doing. Don’t try this if you don’t want to be expelled/suspended.
[/quote]
Same at my college. They have a team of IT guys who sit and watch students on every computer. I also accidentally sat at a teachers computer when I was new at the college and then accidentally switched everyones monitors to one guys monitor. Like 10 minutes later some nerdy man ran through the door with a sheet with all my details including the exact time that I switched everyones monitors.

Lucky my physics teacher knew it wasn’t my fault and we lol’d.[/quote]
lol how’d that happen?

Read full topic
item.source: How to really piss off students/teachers at your school

@bootnecklad wrote:

Read full topic

item.title: How to really piss off students/teachers at your school
item.dc:creator: @davidude36 Brolapse
item.description:
@davidude36 wrote:

Java Is My Life™:

Why would you even attempt this? If your school is anything like mine you need to login with your Student ID/library number and the board administrators can see what you’re doing. Don’t try this if you don’t want to be expelled/suspended.

Same at my college. They have a team of IT guys who sit and watch students on every computer. I also accidentally sat at a teachers computer when I was new at the college and then accidentally switched everyones monitors to one guys monitor. Like 10 minutes later some nerdy man ran through the door with a sheet with all my details including the exact time that I switched everyones monitors.

Lucky my physics teacher knew it wasn’t my fault and we lol’d.

Read full topic

item.title: How to really piss off students/teachers at your school
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

if the server at your school is secure at all it will ask you for a password when you attempt to shutdown the server. last year my school used to be not be as protected as it was very new, so i used to randomly shut down every computer on every class room, but now it requires an admin pass and username >.>, btw the registry at my school dont block Command.exe (or .com), so in yours you might also be able to access this, and run (since registry cant block REG.exe)

REG DELETE HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\Explorer /f REG DELETE HKCU\Software\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\ActiveDesktop /f REG DELETE HKCU\SOFTWARE\Microsoft\Windows\CurrentVersion\Policies\System /f REG DELETE HKCU\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Messenger\Client\ /f REG DELETE HKCU\SOFTWARE\Policies\Microsoft\Windows\System /v DisableCMD /f tskill explorer

gives you access to many useful things.

Read full topic
item.source: How to really piss off students/teachers at your school

item.title: How to really piss off students/teachers at your school
item.dc:creator: @yakman yakman
item.description:
@yakman wrote:

On another topic

Any idea how to do this on Linux? (to a windows server)

wine shutdown -i

works on my box, except i dont have another machine to try it on,

btw, any competent sysadmin will disable their server being turned off like that

Read full topic
